A bicycle, also called a cycle or bike, is a human-powered, pedal-driven, single-track vehicle, having two wheels attached to a frame, one behind the other.

Trek is a bicycle and cycling product manufacturer. The company was founded in 1976, and is based in Waterloo, Wisconsin. With over 1,700 dealers across North America, Europe and Asia, Trek bicycles are sold in over 90 countries worldwide.

The bicycle's simple design, and its efficiency and ease of use, has made it very popular for recreation, commuting, and long-distance bicycle touring.
Bicycles come in a variety of frame designs. A popular traditional bicycle frame design consists of two triangles: a main triangle and a paired rear triangle. This is known as the diamond frame.
